measured_by: proportion of choices in the risky alternative during a repeated two-alternative forced-choice task with equal expected values
justification: The article states that "the relative number of choices in the two alternatives is considered as the empirical risk-preference, where more choices in the risky (safe) alternative are considered as a more risk-seeking (aversion) attitude."

measured_by: proportion of choices in the better alternative in a better/worse paradigm
justification: The Results section explains that participants' "ability to utilize the reverse feedback" was assessed by their "successful identification and maintained exploitation of the better alternative," quantified as the percentage of trials in which the better option was chosen.
